definition: To familiarize oneself with new knowledge or skills, typically through practical experience or training, in order to integrate and apply them effectively in a specific context. This term is commonly used in the context of professional development, where individuals acquire and incorporate new information or techniques into their work routines.

examples.german: Ich muss mich erst in die neue Software einarbeiten.
examples.english: I have to familiarize myself with the new software first.

examples.german: Sie hat sich gut in das Team eingearbeitet.
examples.english: She integrated well into the team.

examples.german: Der neue Mitarbeiter wird langsam in seine Aufgaben eingearbeitet.
examples.english: The new employee is slowly being trained in his tasks.

examples.german: Es dauert eine Weile, bis man sich in die Materie eingearbeitet hat.
examples.english: It takes a while to get familiar with the subject matter.

examples.german: Er hat sich intensiv in das Thema eingearbeitet.
examples.english: He has extensively studied the topic.
